quote-text: Jeremy has been performing unprofessionally for 24 years. He was the youngest of five children and his mother would rather have had a holiday, so dressed him as a caravan for the first six years of his life. He could kill a man with his bare hands if he had bare hands but he doesn’t, he has human hands (this gag still doesn’t work in print — Ed). Jeremy travels the country performing his one-man show, hoping some day to increase the size of his audience to two or even three. He prefers not to publicise his charity work because he doesn’t do any, although he does spend time visiting the elderly, reminding them they’ve got a show to do.
quote-source: Jeremy Hardy, my favourite living comedian, in his biography on the I’m Sorry, I Haven’t A Clue website.
